incidents.name: 1:1 outbound messages sent as email via the Inbox erroneously sent as In-App chat messages

incident_updates.body: Between approximately 2023-01-11 1450 UTC and 2023-01-12 1440 UTC, Intercom customers in US, EU and AUS data hosting regions would have experienced an issue when sending 1:1 outbound email messages via the Inbox. These messages would have been sent as In-App chat messages erroneously. This issue is now resolved and all services are working as expected.

Existing users would have been unaffected during this time. This issue is now resolved and all services are working as expected.

incidents.name: Some customers are experiencing errors with Intercom Messenger not loading in Chrome

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved, and all Intercom Services are working as expected.

Affected customers can change the Messenger Wallpaper following our Customisation Guide here to resolve the error while we roll back a code change: https://www.intercom.com/help/en/articles/178-customize-the-intercom-messenger-basics#h_3236a97925

incidents.name: Issues with Resolution Bot features not working

incident_updates.body: Betweeen approx 2022-08-08 1500 UTC and 2022-08-10 0900 UTC,  Resolution Bot features related to Conversational Topics, Unanswered Questions and Historical Questions were not working. This issue is now resolved and all Resolution Bot features are working as expected.

We are continuing to work on restoring Resolution Bot features, and have now re-enabled the ability of an Intercom Teammate to search for Historical Questions in Resolution Bot. Resolution Bot's ability to answer customer queries in the Intercom Messenger continues to be unaffected at this time.

We expect to bring Resolution Bot's ability to curate Unanswered Questions back online over the next 24 hours.

We have mitigated an issue with Conversational Topics in Resolution Bot, and this feature is now working as expected.

We are still working on bringing Resolution Bot's unanswered questions and historical topic search back online. This will affect an Intercom teammate's ability to create new Resolution Bot answers, but it does not affect Resolution Bot's ability to answer end users. At this time we don't have an ETA for these features being fixed but we will update here as soon as we know more.
We are continuing to investigate this issue. The affected feature are related to Resolution Bot answer curation by Teammates in Intercom, end-users are unaffected at this time.

We are currently investigating issue with the following Resolution Bot feature not working:

* Conversational Topics
* Resolution Bot unanswered questions
* Resolution Bot curation (specifically, the ability to search for historical questions).

incidents.name: Information about Intercom's response to Spring4Shell

incident_updates.body:
Intercom has completed the investigation on its internal systems regarding the security issue in the open-source Spring Framework “Spring4Shell" ( CVE-2022-22965 ) and found that we were not affected.

While we are still completing follow ups with some of our sub-processors, we found no evidence of compromise.

In the unlikely event that Intercom becomes aware of any unauthorized access to customer data through our sub-processors, we will notify impacted customers without undue delay.

Intercom is aware of the security issue relating to the open-source Spring Framework “Spring4Shell".

Spring is a Java-based framework found in a wide number of software products.

The CVE-2022-22965 vulnerability (aka the “Spring4Shell” vulnerability) was disclosed by the Spring Framework project. If exploited, this vulnerability could potentially allow a remote attacker to execute code on the affected server.

Once this vulnerability was publicly disclosed on 31st March 2022, Intercom promptly began an audit of all our software, infrastructure, as well as engaging with our software vendors to determine potential impact. Thus far we have not discovered any impact on our product and infrastructure. 

If Intercom becomes aware of any unauthorized access to customer data, we will notify impacted customers without undue delay. 

This page will be updated in the future if any more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Minor service degradation of Intercom

incident_updates.body: Between 14:47 GMT and 15:03 GMT customers may have experienced minor service degradation affecting all parts of Intercom. This incident is now resolved, and all services are working as expected.
